knimeNode.name: Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney Test
knimeNode.shortDescription: Performs the Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney independent group test.

intro.p: The non-parametric Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test (a.k.a. Mannâ€“Whitney U test, Wilcoxon rank-sum test) tests if two independent samples, with ordinal attributes, originate from populations with the same distribution.
More information can be found at Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test on Wikipedia.

Hypotheses:
H0: the distributions of the populations are the same.
HA: the distributions of the populations are different.

tab.name: Options
tab.option:
Strategy on how missing and Double.NaN values are treated.
Fixed: Missing values will be replaced with Double.NaN.
Failed: An exception is thrown and the node fails to execute.
Maximal: Missing values are considered to be maximal in the ranking.
Minimal: Missing values are considered to be minimal in the ranking.

ports.inPort: Input table with at least one ordinal column and one nominal column (groups).
ports.outPort: Output table with Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test statistics, p-Value, and descriptive statistics of group ranks.
